antispoofing.mcnns.datasets package¶

Submodules¶

antispoofing.mcnns.datasets.dataset module¶

class antispoofing.mcnns.datasets.dataset.Dataset(dataset_path, output_path, iris_location, file_types, operation, max_axis)[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract base class for the dataset that will be used.

This abstract base class implements the cropping operation of the images that will be used in this work since this operation is independent of the dataset in use. Also this base class defines two methods that must me implemented by the subclasses, that is, the build_meta and protocol_eval methods. The build_meta contains the code responsible for creating the metadata of the dataset such as filenames, labels, indexes and some hash structures for all subsets contained into thet dataset. The protocol_eval method implements the evaluation protocol of the dataset.

antispoofing.mcnns.datasets.livdetiris17 module¶

class antispoofing.mcnns.datasets.livdetiris17.LivDetIris17(dataset_path, ground_truth_path='', permutation_path='', iris_location='', output_path='./working', file_types=('.png', '.bmp', '.jpg', '.tiff'), operation='crop', max_axis=320)[source]¶

Bases: antispoofing.mcnns.datasets.dataset.Dataset

Interface for the LivDet Iris 2017 dataset whose evaluation protocol is already defined by the orginizers.

This class uses three auxiliary .text files provided by the LivDetIris2017’s organizers, in which is defined the sets for training, testing and the unknown test.

build_meta(inpath, filetypes)[source]¶

antispoofing.mcnns.datasets.ndcld15 module¶

class antispoofing.mcnns.datasets.ndcld15.NDCLD15(dataset_path, ground_truth_path='', permutation_path='', iris_location='', output_path='./working', file_types=('.png', '.bmp', '.jpg', '.tiff'), operation='crop', max_axis=320)[source]¶

Bases: antispoofing.mcnns.datasets.dataset.Dataset

Interface for the Notre Dame Contact Lenses Dataset 2015 (NDCLD15).

Interface for the Notre Dame Contact Lenses Dataset 2015 (NDCLD15) whose evaluation protocol consists on randomly splitting the samples two equal sets, A and B. After that, we execute our method two times using the sets A and B to train and test a classification model, respectively, and next using the sets B and A, also to train and test another different classification model, respectively. This procedure is repeated by five times and, at the end, we report the mean of the accuracies from the 10 executions.

build_meta(inpath, filetypes)[source]¶
protocol_eval(fold=0, n_fold=5, test_size=0.5)[source]¶

This method implement a 5vs2 cross-validation evaluation protocol.

Parameters:
  • fold (int) – Number of the fold to be used for training and testing
  • n_fold (int) – Total number of folds to be splitted. Defaults to 5.
  • test_size (float) – Size of the testing set. Defaults to 50%.
Returns:

A dictionary containing the training and testing sets.
Return type:

dict
